00041 typedef enum vbr_mode_e {
00042   vbr_off=0,
00043   vbr_mt,               /* obsolete, same as vbr_mtrh */
00044   vbr_rh,
00045   vbr_abr,
00046   vbr_mtrh,
00047   vbr_max_indicator,    /* Don't use this! It's used for sanity checks.       */
00048   vbr_default=vbr_rh    /* change this to change the default VBR mode of LAME */
00049 } vbr_mode;
00050 
00051 
00052 /* MPEG modes */
00053 typedef enum MPEG_mode_e {
00054   STEREO = 0,
00055   JOINT_STEREO,
00056   DUAL_CHANNEL,   /* LAME doesn't supports this! */
00057   MONO,
00058   NOT_SET,
00059   MAX_INDICATOR   /* Don't use this! It's used for sanity checks. */ 
00060 } MPEG_mode;
00061 
00062 /* Padding types */
00063 typedef enum Padding_type_e {
00064   PAD_NO = 0,
00065   PAD_ALL,
00066   PAD_ADJUST,
00067   PAD_MAX_INDICATOR   /* Don't use this! It's used for sanity checks. */
00068 } Padding_type;
00069 
00070 
00071 
00072 /*presets*/
00073 typedef enum preset_mode_e {
00074     /*values from 8 to 320 should be reserved for abr bitrates*/
00075     /*for abr I'd suggest to directly use the targeted bitrate as a value*/
00076     ABR_8 = 8,
00077     ABR_320 = 320,
00078     R3MIX = 1000,
00079     STANDARD = 1001,
00080     EXTREME = 1002,
00081     INSANE = 1003,
00082     STANDARD_FAST = 1004,
00083     EXTREME_FAST = 1005
00084 } preset_mode;
00085 
00086 
00087 /*asm optimizations*/
00088 typedef enum asm_optimizations_e {
00089     MMX = 1,
00090     AMD_3DNOW = 2,
00091     SSE = 3
00092 } asm_optimizations;

00095 struct lame_global_struct;
00096 typedef struct lame_global_struct lame_global_flags;
00097 typedef lame_global_flags *lame_t;

00102 /***********************************************************************
00103  *
00104  *  The LAME API
00105  *  These functions should be called, in this order, for each
00106  *  MP3 file to be encoded 
00107  *
00108  ***********************************************************************/
00109 
00110 
00111 /*
00112  * REQUIRED:
00113  * initialize the encoder.  sets default for all encoder paramters,
00114  * returns -1 if some malloc()'s failed
00115  * otherwise returns 0
00116  */
00117 lame_global_flags * CDECL lame_init(void);
00118 /* obsolete version */
00119 int CDECL lame_init_old(lame_global_flags *);
00120 
00121 
00122 /*
00123  * OPTIONAL:
00124  * set as needed to override defaults
00125  */
00126 
00127 /********************************************************************
00128  *  input stream description
00129  ***********************************************************************/
00130 // number of samples.  default = 2^32-1  
00131 int CDECL lame_set_num_samples(lame_global_flags *, unsigned long);
00132 unsigned long CDECL lame_get_num_samples(const lame_global_flags *);
00133 
00134 // input sample rate in Hz.  default = 44100hz
00135 int CDECL lame_set_in_samplerate(lame_global_flags *, int);
00136 int CDECL lame_get_in_samplerate(const lame_global_flags *);
00137 
00138 // number of channels in input stream. default=2 
00139 int CDECL lame_set_num_channels(lame_global_flags *, int);
00140 int CDECL lame_get_num_channels(const lame_global_flags *);
00141 
00142 // scale the input by this amount before encoding.  default=0 (disabled)
00143 // (not used by decoding routines)
00144 int CDECL lame_set_scale(lame_global_flags *, float);
00145 float CDECL lame_get_scale(const lame_global_flags *);
00146     
00147 // scale the channel 0 (left) input by this amount before encoding.
00148 //   default=0 (disabled)
00149 // (not used by decoding routines)
00150 int CDECL lame_set_scale_left(lame_global_flags *, float);
00151 float CDECL lame_get_scale_left(const lame_global_flags *);
00152 
00153 // scale the channel 1 (right) input by this amount before encoding.
00154 //   default=0 (disabled)
00155 // (not used by decoding routines)
00156 int CDECL lame_set_scale_right(lame_global_flags *, float);
00157 float CDECL lame_get_scale_right(const lame_global_flags *);
00158 
00159 // output sample rate in Hz.  default = 0, which means LAME picks best value 
00160 // based on the amount of compression.  MPEG only allows:
00161 // MPEG1    32, 44.1,   48khz
00162 // MPEG2    16, 22.05,  24
00163 // MPEG2.5   8, 11.025, 12
00164 // (not used by decoding routines)
00165 int CDECL lame_set_out_samplerate(lame_global_flags *, int);
00166 int CDECL lame_get_out_samplerate(const lame_global_flags *);
00167 
00168 
00169 /********************************************************************
00170  *  general control parameters
00171  ***********************************************************************/
00172 // 1=cause LAME to collect data for an MP3 frame analyzer. default=0
00173 int CDECL lame_set_analysis(lame_global_flags *, int);
00174 int CDECL lame_get_analysis(const lame_global_flags *);
00175 
00176 // 1 = write a Xing VBR header frame.
00177 // default = 1 for VBR/ABR modes, 0 for CBR mode
00178 // this variable must have been added by a Hungarian notation Windows programmer :-)
00179 int CDECL lame_set_bWriteVbrTag(lame_global_flags *, int);
00180 int CDECL lame_get_bWriteVbrTag(const lame_global_flags *);
00181 
00182 // 1=decode only.  use lame/mpglib to convert mp3/ogg to wav.  default=0
00183 int CDECL lame_set_decode_only(lame_global_flags *, int);
00184 int CDECL lame_get_decode_only(const lame_global_flags *);
00185 
00186 // 1=encode a Vorbis .ogg file.  default=0
00187 int CDECL lame_set_ogg(lame_global_flags *, int);
00188 int CDECL lame_get_ogg(const lame_global_flags *);
00189 
00190 // internal algorithm selection.  True quality is determined by the bitrate
00191 // but this variable will effect quality by selecting expensive or cheap algorithms.
00192 // quality=0..9.  0=best (very slow).  9=worst.  
00193 // recommended:  2     near-best quality, not too slow
00194 //               5     good quality, fast
00195 //               7     ok quality, really fast
00196 int CDECL lame_set_quality(lame_global_flags *, int);
00197 int CDECL lame_get_quality(const lame_global_flags *);
00198 
00199 // mode = 0,1,2,3 = stereo, jstereo, dual channel (not supported), mono
00200 // default: lame picks based on compression ration and input channels
00201 int CDECL lame_set_mode(lame_global_flags *, MPEG_mode);
00202 MPEG_mode CDECL lame_get_mode(const lame_global_flags *);
00203 
00204 // mode_automs.  Use a M/S mode with a switching threshold based on 
00205 // compression ratio
00206 // default = 0 (disabled)
00207 int CDECL lame_set_mode_automs(lame_global_flags *, int);
00208 int CDECL lame_get_mode_automs(const lame_global_flags *);
00209 
00210 // force_ms.  Force M/S for all frames.  For testing only.
00211 // default = 0 (disabled)
00212 int CDECL lame_set_force_ms(lame_global_flags *, int);
00213 int CDECL lame_get_force_ms(const lame_global_flags *);
00214 
00215 // use free_format?  default = 0 (disabled)
00216 int CDECL lame_set_free_format(lame_global_flags *, int);
00217 int CDECL lame_get_free_format(const lame_global_flags *);
00218 
00219 /*
00220  * OPTIONAL:
00221  * Set printf like error/debug/message reporting functions.
00222  * The second argument has to be a pointer to a function which looks like
00223  *   void my_debugf(const char *format, va_list ap)
00224  *   {
00225  *       (void) vfprintf(stdout, format, ap);
00226  *   }
00227  * If you use NULL as the value of the pointer in the set function, the
00228  * lame buildin function will be used (prints to stderr).
00229  * To quiet any output you have to replace the body of the example function
00230  * with just "return;" and use it in the set function.
00231  */
00232 int CDECL lame_set_errorf(lame_global_flags *,
00233                           void (*func)(const char *, va_list));
00234 int CDECL lame_set_debugf(lame_global_flags *,
00235                           void (*func)(const char *, va_list));
00236 int CDECL lame_set_msgf  (lame_global_flags *,
00237                           void (*func)(const char *, va_list));

00389

00409 int CDECL lame_get_no_short_blocks(const lame_global_flags *);

00415 /* Input PCM is emphased PCM (for instance from one of the rarely
00416    emphased CDs), it is STRONGLY not recommended to use this, because
00417    psycho does not take it into account, and last but not least many decoders
00418    ignore these bits */
00419 int CDECL lame_set_emphasis(lame_global_flags *, int);
00420 int CDECL lame_get_emphasis(const lame_global_flags *);

00424 /************************************************************************/
00425 /* internal variables, cannot be set...                                 */
00426 /* provided because they may be of use to calling application           */
00427 /************************************************************************/
00428 // version  0=MPEG-2  1=MPEG-1  (2=MPEG-2.5)    
00429 int CDECL lame_get_version(const lame_global_flags *);
00430 
00431 // encoder delay  
00432 int CDECL lame_get_encoder_delay(const lame_global_flags *);
00433 
00434 // padding appended to the input to make sure decoder can fully decode
00435 // all input.  Note that this value can only be calculated during the
00436 // call to lame_encoder_flush().  Before lame_encoder_flush() has
00437 // been called, the value of encoder_padding = 0.
00438 int CDECL lame_get_encoder_padding(const lame_global_flags *);
00439 
00440 // size of MPEG frame
00441 int CDECL lame_get_framesize(const lame_global_flags *);
00442 
00443 // number of PCM samples buffered, but not yet encoded to mp3 data.
00444 int CDECL lame_get_mf_samples_to_encode( const lame_global_flags*  gfp );
00445 
00446 // size (bytes) of mp3 data buffered, but not yet encoded.
00447 // this is the number of bytes which would be output by a call to 
00448 // lame_encode_flush_nogap.  NOTE: lame_encode_flush() will return
00449 // more bytes than this because it will encode the reamining buffered
00450 // PCM samples before flushing the mp3 buffers.
00451 int CDECL lame_get_size_mp3buffer( const lame_global_flags*  gfp );
00452 
00453 // number of frames encoded so far
00454 int CDECL lame_get_frameNum(const lame_global_flags *);
00455 
00456 // lame's estimate of the total number of frames to be encoded
00457 // only valid if calling program set num_samples 
00458 int CDECL lame_get_totalframes(const lame_global_flags *);

00475 /*
00476  * OPTIONAL:
00477  * get the version number, in a string. of the form:  
00478  * "3.63 (beta)" or just "3.63". 
00479  */
00480 const char*  CDECL get_lame_version       ( void );
00481 const char*  CDECL get_lame_short_version ( void );
00482 const char*  CDECL get_lame_very_short_version ( void );

00486 /*
00487  * OPTIONAL:
00488  * get the version numbers in numerical form.
00489  */
00490 typedef struct {
00491     /* generic LAME version */
00492     int major;
00493     int minor;
00494     int alpha;               /* 0 if not an alpha version                  */
00495     int beta;                /* 0 if not a beta version                    */
00496 
00497     /* version of the psy model */
00498     int psy_major;
00499     int psy_minor;
00500     int psy_alpha;           /* 0 if not an alpha version                  */
00501     int psy_beta;            /* 0 if not a beta version                    */
00502 
00503     /* compile time features */
00504     const char *features;    /* Don't make assumptions about the contents! */
00505 } lame_version_t;
00506 void CDECL get_lame_version_numerical ( lame_version_t *const );
00507 
00508 
00509 /*
00510  * OPTIONAL:
00511  * print internal lame configuration to message handler
00512  */
00513 void CDECL lame_print_config(const lame_global_flags*  gfp);
00514 
00515 void CDECL lame_print_internals( const lame_global_flags *gfp);
00516 
00517 
00518 /*
00519  * input pcm data, output (maybe) mp3 frames.
00520  * This routine handles all buffering, resampling and filtering for you.
00521  * 
00522  * return code     number of bytes output in mp3buf. Can be 0 
00523  *                 -1:  mp3buf was too small
00524  *                 -2:  malloc() problem
00525  *                 -3:  lame_init_params() not called
00526  *                 -4:  psycho acoustic problems 
00527  *                 -5:  ogg cleanup encoding error
00528  *                 -6:  ogg frame encoding error
00529  *
00530  * The required mp3buf_size can be computed from num_samples, 
00531  * samplerate and encoding rate, but here is a worst case estimate:
00532  *
00533  * mp3buf_size in bytes = 1.25*num_samples + 7200
00534  *
00535  * I think a tighter bound could be:  (mt, March 2000)
00536  * MPEG1:
00537  *    num_samples*(bitrate/8)/samplerate + 4*1152*(bitrate/8)/samplerate + 512
00538  * MPEG2:
00539  *    num_samples*(bitrate/8)/samplerate + 4*576*(bitrate/8)/samplerate + 256
00540  *
00541  * but test first if you use that!
00542  *
00543  * set mp3buf_size = 0 and LAME will not check if mp3buf_size is
00544  * large enough.
00545  *
00546  * NOTE:
00547  * if gfp->num_channels=2, but gfp->mode = 3 (mono), the L & R channels
00548  * will be averaged into the L channel before encoding only the L channel
00549  * This will overwrite the data in buffer_l[] and buffer_r[].
00550  * 
00551 */
00552 int CDECL lame_encode_buffer (
00553         lame_global_flags*  gfp,           /* global context handle         */
00554         const short int     buffer_l [],   /* PCM data for left channel     */
00555         const short int     buffer_r [],   /* PCM data for right channel    */
00556         const int           nsamples,      /* number of samples per channel */
00557         unsigned char*      mp3buf,        /* pointer to encoded MP3 stream */
00558         const int           mp3buf_size ); /* number of valid octets in this
00559                                               stream                        */
00560 
00561 /*
00562  * as above, but input has L & R channel data interleaved.
00563  * NOTE: 
00564  * num_samples = number of samples in the L (or R)
00565  * channel, not the total number of samples in pcm[]  
00566  */
00567 int CDECL lame_encode_buffer_interleaved(
00568         lame_global_flags*  gfp,           /* global context handlei        */
00569         short int           pcm[],         /* PCM data for left and right
00570                                               channel, interleaved          */
00571         int                 num_samples,   /* number of samples per channel,
00572                                               _not_ number of samples in
00573                                               pcm[]                         */
00574         unsigned char*      mp3buf,        /* pointer to encoded MP3 stream */
00575         int                 mp3buf_size ); /* number of valid octets in this
00576                                               stream                        */
00577 
00578 
00579 /* as lame_encode_buffer, but for 'float's.
00580  * !! NOTE: !! data must still be scaled to be in the same range as 
00581  * short int, +/- 32768  
00582  */
00583 int CDECL lame_encode_buffer_float(
00584         lame_global_flags*  gfp,           /* global context handle         */
00585         const float     buffer_l [],       /* PCM data for left channel     */
00586         const float     buffer_r [],       /* PCM data for right channel    */
00587         const int           nsamples,      /* number of samples per channel */
00588         unsigned char*      mp3buf,        /* pointer to encoded MP3 stream */
00589         const int           mp3buf_size ); /* number of valid octets in this
00590                                               stream                        */
00591 
00592 
00593 /* as lame_encode_buffer, but for long's 
00594  * !! NOTE: !! data must still be scaled to be in the same range as 
00595  * short int, +/- 32768  
00596  *
00597  * This scaling was a mistake (doesn't allow one to exploit full
00598  * precision of type 'long'.  Use lame_encode_buffer_long2() instead.
00599  *
00600  */
00601 int CDECL lame_encode_buffer_long(
00602         lame_global_flags*  gfp,           /* global context handle         */
00603         const long     buffer_l [],       /* PCM data for left channel     */
00604         const long     buffer_r [],       /* PCM data for right channel    */
00605         const int           nsamples,      /* number of samples per channel */
00606         unsigned char*      mp3buf,        /* pointer to encoded MP3 stream */
00607         const int           mp3buf_size ); /* number of valid octets in this
00608                                               stream                        */
00609 
00610 /* Same as lame_encode_buffer_long(), but with correct scaling. 
00611  * !! NOTE: !! data must still be scaled to be in the same range as  
00612  * type 'long'.   Data should be in the range:  +/- 2^(8*size(long)-1)
00613  *
00614  */
00615 int CDECL lame_encode_buffer_long2(
00616         lame_global_flags*  gfp,           /* global context handle         */
00617         const long     buffer_l [],       /* PCM data for left channel     */
00618         const long     buffer_r [],       /* PCM data for right channel    */
00619         const int           nsamples,      /* number of samples per channel */
00620         unsigned char*      mp3buf,        /* pointer to encoded MP3 stream */
00621         const int           mp3buf_size ); /* number of valid octets in this
00622                                               stream                        */
00623 
00624 /* as lame_encode_buffer, but for int's 
00625  * !! NOTE: !! input should be scaled to the maximum range of 'int'
00626  * If int is 4 bytes, then the values should range from
00627  * +/- 2147483648.  
00628  *
00629  * This routine does not (and cannot, without loosing precision) use
00630  * the same scaling as the rest of the lame_encode_buffer() routines.
00631  * 
00632  */   
00633 int CDECL lame_encode_buffer_int(
00634         lame_global_flags*  gfp,           /* global context handle         */
00635         const int      buffer_l [],       /* PCM data for left channel     */
00636         const int      buffer_r [],       /* PCM data for right channel    */
00637         const int           nsamples,      /* number of samples per channel */
00638         unsigned char*      mp3buf,        /* pointer to encoded MP3 stream */
00639         const int           mp3buf_size ); /* number of valid octets in this
00640                                               stream                        */
00641 
00642 
00643 
00644 
00645 
00646 /*
00647  * REQUIRED:
00648  * lame_encode_flush will flush the intenal PCM buffers, padding with 
00649  * 0's to make sure the final frame is complete, and then flush
00650  * the internal MP3 buffers, and thus may return a 
00651  * final few mp3 frames.  'mp3buf' should be at least 7200 bytes long
00652  * to hold all possible emitted data.
00653  *
00654  * will also write id3v1 tags (if any) into the bitstream       
00655  *
00656  * return code = number of bytes output to mp3buf. Can be 0
00657  */
00658 int CDECL lame_encode_flush(
00659         lame_global_flags *  gfp,    /* global context handle                 */
00660         unsigned char*       mp3buf, /* pointer to encoded MP3 stream         */
00661         int                  size);  /* number of valid octets in this stream */
00662 
00663 /*
00664  * OPTIONAL:
00665  * lame_encode_flush_nogap will flush the internal mp3 buffers and pad
00666  * the last frame with ancillary data so it is a complete mp3 frame.
00667  * 
00668  * 'mp3buf' should be at least 7200 bytes long
00669  * to hold all possible emitted data.
00670  *
00671  * After a call to this routine, the outputed mp3 data is complete, but
00672  * you may continue to encode new PCM samples and write future mp3 data
00673  * to a different file.  The two mp3 files will play back with no gaps
00674  * if they are concatenated together.
00675  *
00676  * This routine will NOT write id3v1 tags into the bitstream.
00677  *
00678  * return code = number of bytes output to mp3buf. Can be 0
00679  */
00680 int CDECL lame_encode_flush_nogap(
00681         lame_global_flags *  gfp,    /* global context handle                 */
00682         unsigned char*       mp3buf, /* pointer to encoded MP3 stream         */
00683         int                  size);  /* number of valid octets in this stream */
00684 
00685 /*
00686  * OPTIONAL:
00687  * Normally, this is called by lame_init_params().  It writes id3v2 and
00688  * Xing headers into the front of the bitstream, and sets frame counters
00689  * and bitrate histogram data to 0.  You can also call this after 
00690  * lame_encode_flush_nogap().  
00691  */
00692 int CDECL lame_init_bitstream(
00693         lame_global_flags *  gfp);    /* global context handle                 */
00694 
00695 
00696 
00697 /*
00698  * OPTIONAL:    some simple statistics
00699  * a bitrate histogram to visualize the distribution of used frame sizes
00700  * a stereo mode histogram to visualize the distribution of used stereo
00701  *   modes, useful in joint-stereo mode only
00702  *   0: LR    left-right encoded
00703  *   1: LR-I  left-right and intensity encoded (currently not supported)
00704  *   2: MS    mid-side encoded
00705  *   3: MS-I  mid-side and intensity encoded (currently not supported)
00706  *
00707  * attention: don't call them after lame_encode_finish
00708  * suggested: lame_encode_flush -> lame_*_hist -> lame_close
00709  */
00710 
00711 void CDECL lame_bitrate_hist( 
00712         const lame_global_flags *const gfp, 
00713               int                      bitrate_count[14] );
00714 void CDECL lame_bitrate_kbps( 
00715         const lame_global_flags *const gfp, 
00716               int                      bitrate_kbps [14] );
00717 void CDECL lame_stereo_mode_hist( 
00718         const lame_global_flags *const gfp, 
00719               int                      stereo_mode_count[4] );
00720 
00721 void CDECL lame_bitrate_stereo_mode_hist ( 
00722         const lame_global_flags * const gfp, 
00723         int  bitrate_stmode_count [14] [4] );
00724 
00725 
00726 /*
00727  * OPTIONAL:
00728  * lame_mp3_tags_fid will append a Xing VBR tag to the mp3 file with file
00729  * pointer fid.  These calls perform forward and backwards seeks, so make
00730  * sure fid is a real file.  Make sure lame_encode_flush has been called,
00731  * and all mp3 data has been written to the file before calling this
00732  * function.
00733  * NOTE:
00734  * if VBR  tags are turned off by the user, or turned off by LAME because
00735  * the output is not a regular file, this call does nothing
00736 */
00737 void CDECL lame_mp3_tags_fid(lame_global_flags *,FILE* fid);
00738 
00739 
00740 /*
00741  * REQUIRED:
00742  * final call to free all remaining buffers
00743  */
00744 int  CDECL lame_close (lame_global_flags *);
00745 
00746 /*
00747  * OBSOLETE:
00748  * lame_encode_finish combines lame_encode_flush() and lame_close() in
00749  * one call.  However, once this call is made, the statistics routines
00750  * will no longer work because the data will have been cleared
00751  */
00752 int CDECL lame_encode_finish(
00753         lame_global_flags*  gfp,
00754         unsigned char*      mp3buf,
00755         int                 size );
00756

00758 
00759 
00760 
00761 
00762 
00763 /*********************************************************************
00764  *
00765  * decoding 
00766  *
00767  * a simple interface to mpglib, part of mpg123, is also included if
00768  * libmp3lame is compiled with HAVE_MPGLIB
00769  *
00770  *********************************************************************/
00771 typedef struct {
00772   int header_parsed;   /* 1 if header was parsed and following data was
00773                           computed                                       */
00774   int stereo;          /* number of channels                             */
00775   int samplerate;      /* sample rate                                    */
00776   int bitrate;         /* bitrate                                        */
00777   int mode;            /* mp3 frame type                                 */
00778   int mode_ext;        /* mp3 frame type                                 */
00779   int framesize;       /* number of samples per mp3 frame                */
00780 
00781   /* this data is only computed if mpglib detects a Xing VBR header */
00782   unsigned long nsamp; /* number of samples in mp3 file.                 */
00783   int totalframes;     /* total number of frames in mp3 file             */
00784 
00785   /* this data is not currently computed by the mpglib routines */
00786   int framenum;        /* frames decoded counter                         */
00787 } mp3data_struct;
00788 
00789 
00790 /* required call to initialize decoder */
00791 int CDECL lame_decode_init(void);
00792 
00793 /*********************************************************************
00794  * input 1 mp3 frame, output (maybe) pcm data.  
00795  * lame_decode() return code:
00796  *   -1: error
00797  *    0: need more data
00798  *  n>0: size of pcm output
00799  *********************************************************************/
00800 int CDECL lame_decode(
00801         unsigned char *  mp3buf,
00802         int              len,
00803         short            pcm_l[],
00804         short            pcm_r[] );
00805 
00806 /* same as lame_decode, and also returns mp3 header data */
00807 int CDECL lame_decode_headers(
00808         unsigned char*   mp3buf,
00809         int              len,
00810         short            pcm_l[],
00811         short            pcm_r[],
00812         mp3data_struct*  mp3data );
00813 
00814 /* same as lame_decode, but returns at most one frame */
00815 int CDECL lame_decode1(
00816         unsigned char*  mp3buf,
00817         int             len,
00818         short           pcm_l[],
00819         short           pcm_r[] );
00820 
00821 /* same as lame_decode1, but returns at most one frame and mp3 header data */
00822 int CDECL lame_decode1_headers(
00823         unsigned char*   mp3buf,
00824         int              len,
00825         short            pcm_l[],
00826         short            pcm_r[],
00827         mp3data_struct*  mp3data );
00828 
00829 /* same as lame_decode1_headers, but also returns enc_delay and enc_padding
00830    from VBR Info tag, (-1 if no info tag was found) */
00831 int CDECL lame_decode1_headersB(
00832         unsigned char*   mp3buf,
00833         int              len,
00834         short            pcm_l[],
00835         short            pcm_r[],
00836         mp3data_struct*  mp3data,
00837         int              *enc_delay,
00838         int              *enc_padding );

00916 /***********************************************************************
00917 *
00918 *  list of valid bitrates [kbps] & sample frequencies [Hz].
00919 *  first index: 0: MPEG-2   values  (sample frequencies 16...24 kHz) 
00920 *               1: MPEG-1   values  (sample frequencies 32...48 kHz)
00921 *               2: MPEG-2.5 values  (sample frequencies  8...12 kHz)
00922 ***********************************************************************/
00923 extern const int      bitrate_table    [3] [16];
00924 extern const int      samplerate_table [3] [ 4];

00928 /* maximum size of mp3buffer needed if you encode at most 1152 samples for
00929    each call to lame_encode_buffer.  see lame_encode_buffer() below  
00930    (LAME_MAXMP3BUFFER is now obsolete)  */
00931 #define LAME_MAXMP3BUFFER   16384
